body_html:
So I looked into the handling of keeping or not dimensions per @apaszke 's comment.
I make the working assumption that we want to use the given order of reductions. (Please correct me if you believe I should not). Then it is possible to replace "keep first, squeeze later" if one distinguishes the two cases and converts the indices to incremental reductions. However, that is a bit elaborate, so in terms of code size (t-vi@48bb8d8), I think keeping it as is is the most practical solution.
body_text:
So I looked into the handling of keeping or not dimensions per @apaszke 's comment.
I make the working assumption that we want to use the given order of reductions. (Please correct me if you believe I should not). Then it is possible to replace "keep first, squeeze later" if one distinguishes the two cases and converts the indices to incremental reductions. However, that is a bit elaborate, so in terms of code size (t-vi@48bb8d8), I think keeping it as is is the most practical solution.
body:
So I looked into the handling of keeping or not dimensions per @apaszke 's comment.
I make the working assumption that we want to use the given order of reductions. (Please correct me if you believe I should not). Then it is possible to replace "keep first, squeeze later" if one distinguishes the two cases and converts the indices to incremental reductions. However, that is a bit elaborate, so in terms of code size (https://github.com/t-vi/pytorch/commit/48bb8d8a93279e61e4b3636c5b5d7ecc33bd72cb), I think keeping it as is is the most practical solution.
